item.title: Executable READMEs
item.description: README file typically contain information about the project itself, for example how it can be installed/used/build. Most of the time these files contains command line instructions that users/contributors copy and paste into their terminal. Instead of doing that, consider placing a Makefile in the root of your project which contains the exact same instructions. Thanks to make, all your contributors can now use TAB-completion to run any of the pre-defined make targets.
